intro: Agoseris chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Agoseris chilensis has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in open areas with well-drained soil. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
